intro: Spermacoce brownii, commonly known as the brown sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and hairy leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds. Spermacoce brownii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and along roadsides.
